t: Luke 9
Ministry of the Twelve
And*p He called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all the demons and to heal diseases.
And He sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to perform healing.
And He said to them, “Take*r nothing*r for*r your*ir journey,*r neither*r a*r staff,*r nor*r a*r bag,*r nor*r bread,*r nor*r money;*r and*r do*r not*r even*ir have*r two*r tunics*r apiece.*r
Whatever*r house*r you*r enter,*r stay*r there*r until*r you*r leave*r that*r city.*r
And*r as*r for*r those*r who*r do*r not*r receive*r you,*r as*r you*r go*r out*r from*r that*r city,*r shake*r the*r dust*r off*r your*r feet*r as*r a*r testimony*r against*r them.”*r
Departing, they began*i going throughout the villages, preaching the gospel and healing everywhere.
Now*p Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was happening; and he was greatly perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead,
and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the prophets of old had risen again.
Herod said, “I myself had John beheaded; but who is this man about whom I hear such things?” And he kept trying to see Him.
When*p the apostles returned, they gave an account to Him of all that they had done. Taking them with Him, He withdrew by Himself to a city called Bethsaida.
But the crowds were aware of this and followed Him; and welcoming them, He began*i speaking to them about the kingdom of God and curing those who had need of healing.
Five Thousand Fed

Now*p the day was ending, and the twelve came and said to Him, “Send the crowd away, that they may go into the surrounding villages and countryside and find lodging and get something to eat; for here we are in a desolate place.”
But He said to them, “You*r give*r them*r something*ir to*r eat!”*r And they said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless perhaps we go and buy food for all these people.”
(For there were about five thousand men.) And He said to His disciples, “Have*r them*r sit*r down*r to*ir eat*ir in*r groups*r of*r about*r fifty*r each.”*r
They did so, and had them all sit down.
Then He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed them, and broke them,*i and kept giving them*i to the disciples to set before the people.
And they all ate and were satisfied; and the broken pieces which they had left over were picked up, twelve baskets full.*i
And*p it happened that while He was praying alone, the disciples were with Him, and He questioned them, saying, “Who*r do*r the*r people*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r
They answered and said, “John the Baptist, and others say*i Elijah; but others, that one of the prophets of old has risen again.”
And He said to them, “But*r who*r do*r you*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r And Peter answered and said, “The Christ of God.”
But He warned them and instructed them*i not to tell this to anyone,

saying, “The*r Son*r of*r Man*r must*r suffer*r many*r things*r and*r be*r rejected*r by*r the*r elders*r and*r chief*r priests*r and*r scribes,*r and*r be*r killed*r and*r be*r raised*r up*r on*r the*r third*r day.”*r
And*p He was saying to them*i all, “If*r anyone*r wishes*r to*r come*r after*r Me,*r he*r must*r deny*r himself,*r and*r take*r up*r his*r cross*r daily*r and*r follow*r Me.*r
For*r whoever*r wishes*r to*r save*r his*r life*r will*r lose*r it,*r but*r whoever*r loses*r his*r life*r for*r My*r sake,*r he*r is*r the*r one*r who*r will*r save*r it.*r
For*r what*r is*r a*r man*r profited*r if*r he*r gains*r the*r whole*r world,*r and*r loses*r or*r forfeits*r himself?*r

For*r whoever*r is*r ashamed*r of*r Me*r and*r My*r words,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r ashamed*r of*r him*r when*r He*r comes*r in*r His*r glory,*r and*r the*ir glory*ir of*r the*r Father*r and*r of*r the*r holy*r angels.*r
But*r I*r say*r to*r you*r truthfully,*r there*r are*r some*r of*r those*r standing*r here*r who*r will*r not*r taste*r death*r until*r they*r see*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
The Transfiguration
Some*p eight days after these sayings, He took along Peter and John and James, and went up on the mountain to pray.
And while He was praying, the appearance of His face became different, and His clothing became*i white and*i gleaming.
And behold, two men were talking with Him; and they were Moses and Elijah,
who, appearing in glory, were speaking of His departure which He was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.
Now Peter and his companions had been overcome with sleep; but when they were fully awake, they saw His glory and the two men standing with Him.

And as these were leaving Him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here; let us make three tabernacles: one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah”—not realizing what he was saying.
While he was saying this, a cloud formed and began*i to overshadow them; and they were afraid as they entered the cloud.
Then a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My Son, My*i Chosen One; listen to Him!”
And when the voice had spoken, Jesus was found alone. And they kept silent, and reported to no one in those days any of the things which they had seen.
On*p the next day, when they came down from the mountain, a large crowd met Him.
And a man from the crowd shouted, saying, “Teacher, I beg You to look at my son, for he is my only boy,*i
and a spirit seizes him, and he suddenly screams, and it throws him into a convulsion with foaming at*i the*i mouth;*i and only with difficulty does it leave him, mauling him as*i it*i leaves.*i
I begged Your disciples to cast it out, and they could not.”
And Jesus answered and said, “You*r unbelieving*r and*r perverted*r generation,*r how*r long*r shall*r I*r be*r with*r you*r and*r put*r up*r with*r you?*r Bring*r your*r son*r here.”*r
While he was still approaching, the demon slammed him to*i the*i ground*i and threw him into a convulsion. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the boy and gave him back to his father.
And they were all amazed at the greatness of God. But*bp while everyone was marveling at all that He was doing, He said to His disciples,
“Let*r these*r words*r sink*r into*r your*r ears;*r for*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r going*r to*r be*r delivered*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r men.”*r
But they did not understand this statement, and it was concealed from them so that they would not perceive it; and they were afraid to ask Him about this statement.
The Test of Greatness
An*p argument started among them as to which of them might be the greatest.
But Jesus, knowing what they were thinking in their heart, took a child and stood him by His side,

and said to them, “Whoever*r receives*r this*r child*r in*r My*r name*r receives*r Me,*r and*r whoever*r receives*r Me*r receives*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me;*r for*r the*r one*r who*r is*r least*r among*r all*r of*r you,*r this*r is*r the*r one*r who*r is*r great.”*r
John*p answered and said, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in Your name; and we tried to prevent him because he does not follow along with us.”
But Jesus said to him, “Do*r not*r hinder*r him;*ir for*r he*r who*r is*r not*r against*r you*r is*r for*r you.”*r
When*p the days were approaching for His ascension, He was determined to go to Jerusalem;
and He sent messengers on ahead of Him, and they went and entered a village of the Samaritans to make arrangements for Him.
But they did not receive Him, because He was traveling toward Jerusalem.
When His disciples James and John saw this,*i they said, “Lord, do You want us to command fire to come down from heaven and consume them?”
But He turned and rebuked them, [and said, “You*r do*r not*r know*r what*r kind*r of*r spirit*r you*r are*r of;*r
for*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r did*r not*r come*r to*r destroy*r men’s*r lives,*r but*r to*r save*r them.”]*r And they went on to another village.
Exacting Discipleship
As*p they were going along the road, someone said to Him, “I will follow You wherever You go.”
And Jesus said to him, “The*r foxes*r have*r holes*r and*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r have*ir nests,*r but*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r nowhere*r to*r lay*r His*r head.”*r
And He said to another, “Follow*r Me.”*r But he said, “Lord, permit me first to go and bury my father.”
But He said to him, “Allow*r the*r dead*r to*r bury*r their*r own*r dead;*r but*r as*r for*r you,*r go*r and*r proclaim*r everywhere*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
Another also said, “I will follow You, Lord; but first permit me to say good-bye to those at home.”
But Jesus said to him, “No*r one,*r after*r putting*r his*r hand*r to*r the*r plow*r and*r looking*r back,*r is*r fit*r for*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
